channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Real-world image dehazing with improved joint enhancement and exposure fusion
item.description: The visual and quantitative comparisons between the proposed method and state-of-the-art dehazing methods show that the proposed method has better dehazing performance and has a 50% improvement in terms of the FADE metric compared to the closest result.

item.title: A Transformer Model for Symbolic Regression towards Scientific Discovery
item.description: Once trained, we apply our best model to the SRSD datasets (Symbolic Regression for Scientific Discovery datasets) which yields state-of-the-art results using the normalized tree-based edit distance, at no extra computational cost.

item.title: Smooth Diffusion: Crafting Smooth Latent Spaces in Diffusion Models
item.description: Specifically, we introduce Step-wise Variation Regularization to enforce the proportion between the variations of an arbitrary input latent and that of the output image is a constant at any diffusion training step.

item.title: RAVE: Randomized Noise Shuffling for Fast and Consistent Video Editing with Diffusion Models
item.description: Recent advancements in diffusion-based models have demonstrated significant success in generating images from text.

item.title: EulerMormer: Robust Eulerian Motion Magnification via Dynamic Filtering within Transformer
item.description: Then, we introduce a novel dynamic filter that eliminates noise cues and preserves critical features in the motion magnification and amplification generation phases.

item.title: Combining inherent knowledge of vision-language models with unsupervised domain adaptation through self-knowledge distillation
item.description: In a first step, we generate the zero-shot predictions of the source and target dataset using the vision-language model.

item.title: Prompt Highlighter: Interactive Control for Multi-Modal LLMs
item.description: Without tuning on LLaVA-v1. 5, our method secured 69. 5 in the MMBench test and 1552. 5 in MME-perception.

item.title: Augmentation-Free Dense Contrastive Knowledge Distillation for Efficient Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In order to address this problem, we present Augmentation-free Dense Contrastive Knowledge Distillation (Af-DCD), a new contrastive distillation learning paradigm to train compact and accurate deep neural networks for semantic segmentation applications.

item.title: On the adaptation of in-context learners for system identification
item.description: In-context system identification aims at constructing meta-models to describe classes of systems, differently from traditional approaches that model single systems.

item.title: Merging by Matching Models in Task Subspaces
item.description: Model merging aims to cheaply combine individual task-specific models into a single multitask model.

item.title: Probabilistic volumetric speckle suppression in OCT using deep learning
item.description: We present a deep learning framework for volumetric speckle reduction in optical coherence tomography (OCT) based on a conditional generative adversarial network (cGAN) that leverages the volumetric nature of OCT data.

item.title: On the Impact of Multi-dimensional Local Differential Privacy on Fairness
item.description: Automated decision systems are increasingly used to make consequential decisions in people's lives.

item.title: CODEX: A Cluster-Based Method for Explainable Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Despite the impressive feats demonstrated by Reinforcement Learning (RL), these algorithms have seen little adoption in high-risk, real-world applications due to current difficulties in explaining RL agent actions and building user trust.

item.title: RoAST: Robustifying Language Models via Adversarial Perturbation with Selective Training
item.description: Under a unified evaluation of fine-tuned LMs by incorporating four representative perspectives of model robustness, we demonstrate the effectiveness of RoAST compared to state-of-the-art fine-tuning methods on six different types of LMs, which indicates its usefulness in practice.

item.title: Open-Vocabulary Segmentation with Semantic-Assisted Calibration
item.description: We attribute this to the in-vocabulary embedding and domain-biased CLIP prediction.

item.title: An LLM Compiler for Parallel Function Calling
item.description: LLMCompiler automatically computes an optimized orchestration for the function calls and can be used with open-source models such as LLaMA-2.

item.title: On the Learnability of Watermarks for Language Models
item.description: Watermarking of language model outputs enables statistical detection of model-generated text, which has many applications in the responsible deployment of language models.

item.title: Cost-Effective In-Context Learning for Entity Resolution: A Design Space Exploration
item.description: However, existing ICL approaches to ER typically necessitate providing a task description and a set of demonstrations for each entity pair and thus have limitations on the monetary cost of interfacing LLMs.

item.title: OpenAsp: A Benchmark for Multi-document Open Aspect-based Summarization
item.description: To advance research on more realistic scenarios, we introduce OpenAsp, a benchmark for multi-document \textit{open} aspect-based summarization.

item.title: GPT-4V with Emotion: A Zero-shot Benchmark for Multimodal Emotion Understanding
item.description: This paper quantitatively evaluates GPT-4V's capabilities in multimodal emotion understanding, encompassing tasks such as facial emotion recognition, visual sentiment analysis, micro-expression recognition, dynamic facial emotion recognition, and multimodal emotion recognition.

item.title: FRNet: Frustum-Range Networks for Scalable LiDAR Segmentation
item.description: Firstly, a frustum feature encoder module is used to extract per-point features within the frustum region, which preserves scene consistency and is crucial for point-level predictions.

item.title: DiscoBAX: Discovery of Optimal Intervention Sets in Genomic Experiment Design
item.description: The discovery of therapeutics to treat genetically-driven pathologies relies on identifying genes involved in the underlying disease mechanisms.

item.title: Fortify the Shortest Stave in Attention: Enhancing Context Awareness of Large Language Models for Effective Tool Use
item.description: In this paper, we argue that a waveform pattern in the model's attention allocation has an impact on the tool use performance, which degrades when the position of essential information hits the trough zone.

item.title: Guided Reconstruction with Conditioned Diffusion Models for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection in Brain MRIs
item.description: Using our proposed conditioning mechanism we can reduce the false-positive predictions and enable a more precise delineation of anomalies which significantly enhances the anomaly detection performance compared to established state-of-the-art approaches to unsupervised anomaly detection in brain MRI.

item.title: Scaling Laws of Synthetic Images for Model Training ... for Now
item.description: Our findings also suggest that scaling synthetic data can be particularly effective in scenarios such as: (1) when there is a limited supply of real images for a supervised problem (e. g., fewer than 0. 5 million images in ImageNet), (2) when the evaluation dataset diverges significantly from the training data, indicating the out-of-distribution scenario, or (3) when synthetic data is used in conjunction with real images, as demonstrated in the training of CLIP models.

item.title: CLadder: A Benchmark to Assess Causal Reasoning Capabilities of Language Models
item.description: Much of the existing work in natural language processing (NLP) focuses on evaluating commonsense causal reasoning in LLMs, thus failing to assess whether a model can perform causal inference in accordance with a set of well-defined formal rules.

item.title: PsyChat: A Client-Centric Dialogue System for Mental Health Support
item.description: Dialogue systems are increasingly integrated into mental health support to help clients facilitate exploration, gain insight, take action, and ultimately heal themselves.

item.title: MIMo: A Multi-Modal Infant Model for Studying Cognitive Development
item.description: Human intelligence and human consciousness emerge gradually during the process of cognitive development.

item.title: Instance Tracking in 3D Scenes from Egocentric Videos
item.description: We explore this problem by first introducing a new benchmark dataset, consisting of RGB and depth videos, per-frame camera pose, and instance-level annotations in both 2D camera and 3D world coordinates.

item.title: Adversarial Learning for Feature Shift Detection and Correction
item.description: Data shift is a phenomenon present in many real-world applications, and while there are multiple methods attempting to detect shifts, the task of localizing and correcting the features originating such shifts has not been studied in depth.

item.title: A Multi-scale Information Integration Framework for Infrared and Visible Image Fusion
item.description: In this study, we propose a multi-scale dual attention (MDA) framework for infrared and visible image fusion, which is designed to measure and integrate complementary information in both structure and loss function at the image and patch level.

item.title: Towards 4D Human Video Stylization
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we leverage Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs) to represent videos, conducting stylization in the rendered feature space.

item.title: Activity Grammars for Temporal Action Segmentation
item.description: Sequence prediction on temporal data requires the ability to understand compositional structures of multi-level semantics beyond individual and contextual properties.

item.title: Free3D: Consistent Novel View Synthesis without 3D Representation
item.description: We introduce Free3D, a simple approach designed for open-set novel view synthesis (NVS) from a single image.

item.title: PrimDiffusion: Volumetric Primitives Diffusion for 3D Human Generation
item.description: We present PrimDiffusion, the first diffusion-based framework for 3D human generation.

item.title: Caregiver Talk Shapes Toddler Vision: A Computational Study of Dyadic Play
item.description: For this we propose a computational model of visual representation learning during dyadic play.

item.title: Beyond Surface: Probing LLaMA Across Scales and Layers
item.description: This paper presents an in-depth analysis of Large Language Models (LLMs), focusing on LLaMA, a prominent open-source foundational model in natural language processing.

item.title: Constraint Model for the Satellite Image Mosaic Selection Problem
item.description: More precisely, for this problem the input is an area of interest, several satellite images intersecting the area, a list of requirements relative to the image and the mosaic, such as cloud coverage percentage, image resolution, and a list of objectives to optimize.

item.title: Small Area Estimation of Case Growths for Timely COVID-19 Outbreak Detection
item.description: Furthermore, we conducted a case study based on outbreak case data from the state of Colorado and showed that the timely detection of outbreaks could have been improved by up to 224% using TLGRF when compared to the decisions made by Colorado's Department of Health and Environment (CDPHE).

item.title: Language Model Knowledge Distillation for Efficient Question Answering in Spanish
item.description: Recent advances in the development of pre-trained Spanish language models has led to significant progress in many Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks, such as question answering.

item.title: Differentiable Registration of Images and LiDAR Point Clouds with VoxelPoint-to-Pixel Matching
item.description: To address these problems, we propose to learn a structured cross-modality latent space to represent pixel features and 3D features via a differentiable probabilistic PnP solver.

item.title: MuRF: Multi-Baseline Radiance Fields
item.description: We present Multi-Baseline Radiance Fields (MuRF), a general feed-forward approach to solving sparse view synthesis under multiple different baseline settings (small and large baselines, and different number of input views).

item.title: Emotional Speech-driven 3D Body Animation via Disentangled Latent Diffusion
item.description: Once trained, AMUSE synthesizes 3D human gestures directly from speech with control over the expressed emotions and style by combining the content from the driving speech with the emotion and style of another speech sequence.

item.title: Towards Knowledge-driven Autonomous Driving
item.description: This paper explores the emerging knowledge-driven autonomous driving technologies.

item.title: Learn to Unlearn for Deep Neural Networks: Minimizing Unlearning Interference with Gradient Projection
item.description: Recent data-privacy laws have sparked interest in machine unlearning, which involves removing the effect of specific training samples from a learnt model as if they were never present in the original training dataset.

item.title: Equivariant Scalar Fields for Molecular Docking with Fast Fourier Transforms
item.description: The runtime of our approach can be amortized at several levels of abstraction, and is particularly favorable for virtual screening settings with a common binding pocket.

item.title: Series2Vec: Similarity-based Self-supervised Representation Learning for Time Series Classification
item.description: Our evaluation of Series2Vec on nine large real-world datasets, along with the UCR/UEA archive, shows enhanced performance compared to current state-of-the-art self-supervised techniques for time series.

item.title: nerblackbox: A High-level Library for Named Entity Recognition in Python
item.description: We present nerblackbox, a python library to facilitate the use of state-of-the-art transformer-based models for named entity recognition.

item.title: A Structural-Clustering Based Active Learning for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: To address this problem, we propose the Structural-Clustering PageRank method for improved Active learning (SPA) specifically designed for graph-structured data.

item.title: MeanCut: A Greedy-Optimized Graph Clustering via Path-based Similarity and Degree Descent Criterion
item.description: As the most typical graph clustering method, spectral clustering is popular and attractive due to the remarkable performance, easy implementation, and strong adaptability.
